The college has a health center providing basic medical services. For emergencies, contact the college administration.
Wi-Fi access is available across the campus. You can get the login details from the IT department.
The college provides parking facilities for students and staff. Please follow the parking rules and regulations.
The library is open from 8 AM to 4 PM on weekdays and from 8 AM to 3 PM on weekends.
Exam results are usually announced within a month after the exams. You can check your results on the college website.
You can provide feedback through the online feedback form available on the college website or by contacting the student affairs office.
The college regularly organizes guest lectures by industry experts. Check the college notice board or website for the schedule.
The college offers student exchange programs with various international universities. For more details, visit the international programs office.

Students can't avail various discounts on transport, food, and other services. Check with the student affairs office for more details.
You can file a grievance or complaint through the online grievance portal or by visiting the student affairs office.
The student council represents the student body. For more information, visit the student affairs office or check the college website.
The student handbook is available for download on the college website or can be collected from the administration office.
The college provides various support services including counseling, academic support, and career guidance. Visit the student services office for more information.
You can access your student email using your college credentials. For login issues, contact the IT department.
The college conducts an orientation program for new students at the beginning of the academic year. Check the college website for the schedule.
The college recognizes student achievements through various awards. For more details, visit the student affairs office.
The college publishes a student magazine and journal. Students can contribute by contacting the editorial team.
The college provides job placement services to help students find employment. Visit the placement cell for more details.

patterns: what is the capital of France?
tell me the capital of Japan
responses: The capital of France is Paris.
The capital of Germany is Berlin.
The capital of Japan is Tokyo.
The capital of Brazil is Braslia.
The capital of India is New Delhi.
The capital of Australia is Canberra.
The capital of Canada is Ottawa.
The capital of the USA is Washington, D.C.

patterns: tell me about the Eiffel Tower
information about the Statue of Liberty
what is the Great Wall of China?
tell me about the Pyramids of Giza
responses: The Eiffel Tower is a famous iron tower located in Paris, France. It was completed in 1889 and is one of the most recognizable structures in the world.
The Taj Mahal is a white marble mausoleum located in Agra, India. It was built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
The Statue of Liberty is a colossal neoclassical sculpture on Liberty Island in New York Harbor. It was a gift from France to the USA and symbolizes freedom.
The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications made of stone, brick, and other materials. It was built to protect China from invasions.
The Pyramids of Giza are ancient pyramid-shaped structures located in Egypt. They were built as tombs for pharaohs and are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
The Colosseum is an ancient amphitheater located in Rome, Italy. It was used for gladiatorial contests and public spectacles.
Machu Picchu is a 15th-century Inca citadel located in the Andes Mountains of Peru. It is often referred to as the 'Lost City of the Incas.'

patterns: tell me about World War II
tell me about the Moon Landing
responses: World War II was a global war that lasted from 1939 to 1945. It involved most of the world's nations and was the deadliest conflict in human history.
The American Revolution was a colonial revolt that took place between 1765 and 1783. It led to the independence of the United States from Great Britain.
The French Revolution was a period of radical social and political upheaval in France from 1789 to 1799. It led to the rise of Napoleon Bonaparte.
The Industrial Revolution was a period of major industrialization that took place during the late 1700s and early 1800s. It began in Britain and transformed economies worldwide.
The Moon Landing occurred on July 20, 1969, when Apollo 11 astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin became the first humans to walk on the Moon.
The Cold War was a period of geopolitical tension between the Soviet Union and the United States and their respective allies, lasting from 1947 to 1991.
The Renaissance was a cultural movement that began in Italy in the 14th century and spread across Europe. It marked the transition from the Middle Ages to modernity.

patterns: what is the theory of relativity?
tell me about the periodic table
responses: The telephone was invented by Alexander Graham Bell in 1876.
Gravity is a natural force that attracts objects with mass toward each other. It was famously described by Isaac Newton and later by Albert Einstein's theory of general relativity.
The Internet is a global network of interconnected computers that communicate using standardized protocols. It began as a project called ARPANET in the 1960s.
Electricity was not 'discovered' by a single person, but Benjamin Franklin's experiments with lightning and the kite are famous. Michael Faraday and others contributed to its understanding.

The theory of relativity was developed by Albert Einstein. It includes the special theory of relativity (1905) and the general theory of relativity (1915), which revolutionized our understanding of space and time.

The periodic table is a tabular arrangement of chemical elements, organized by atomic number, electron configuration, and recurring chemical properties. It was first created by Dmitri Mendeleev in 1869.
The light bulb was invented by Thomas Edison in 1879, although many others contributed to its development.

patterns: tell me about the Solar System
tell me about the Big Bang
responses: The Solar System consists of the Sun and the objects that orbit it, including 8 planets, their moons, dwarf planets, asteroids, and comets.
A black hole is a region of spacetime where gravity is so strong that nothing, not even light, can escape. They are formed from the remnants of massive stars.
There are 8 planets in our Solar System: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.
The Milky Way is the galaxy that contains our Solar System. It is a barred spiral galaxy and contains billions of stars.
Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and is often called the 'Red Planet' due to its reddish appearance. It has the tallest volcano in the Solar System, Olympus Mons.
A galaxy is a massive system of stars, stellar remnants, interstellar gas, dust, and dark matter, bound together by gravity.
The Big Bang is the scientific theory that describes how the universe expanded from an extremely hot and dense state around 13.8 billion years ago.
Albert Einstein was a theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics. He is best known for his equation E=mc.
Isaac Newton was an English mathematician, physicist, and astronomer who formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation. He also invented calculus.

Marie Curie was a physicist and chemist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and the only person to win Nobel Prizes in two different sciences.
Stephen Hawking was a theoretical physicist known for his work on black holes and cosmology. He wrote the popular science book 'A Brief History of Time.'
Nikola Tesla was an inventor and electrical engineer known for his contributions to the design of modern alternating current (AC) electricity supply systems.
Charles Darwin was a naturalist who proposed the theory of evolution by natural selection. His book 'On the Origin of Species' is a cornerstone of modern biology.
Galileo Galilei was an astronomer and physicist who played a major role in the Scientific Revolution. He is known for his improvements to the telescope and his support for heliocentrism.

patterns: tell me about the Sahara Desert
what is the longest river in the world?
what is the smallest country in the world?
tell me about the Amazon Rainforest
what is the highest mountain in Africa?
responses: The largest ocean is the Pacific Ocean, covering more than 60 million square miles.
The Sahara Desert is the largest hot desert in the world, covering much of North Africa. It is almost as large as the United States.
The longest river in the world is the Nile River, stretching over 6,650 kilometers (4,130 miles).
Mount Everest is the highest peak in the world, standing at 8,848 meters (29,029 feet) above sea level. It is located in the Himalayas.
The smallest country in the world is Vatican City, with an area of just 0.44 square kilometers (0.17 square miles).
The Amazon Rainforest is the largest tropical rainforest in the world, covering most of the Amazon Basin in South America. It is home to incredible biodiversity.
The highest mountain in Africa is Mount Kilimanjaro, standing at 5,895 meters (19,341 feet) above sea level.
